212.title: Rise of anti-semitism in wake of Gaza war plays into the hands of far-right, expert says
212.summary: Auschwitz survivors warned Monday of the rising antisemitism and hatred which they are witnessing in the modern world as they gathered with world leaders and European royalty on the 80th anniversary of the death camp's liberation. FRANCE 24's Gavin Lee speaks to David Lees, Associate Professor of French Studies, at the University of Warwick. He says that the conflict in Gaza has heightened anti-semitism across the world, playing into the hands of far-right movements and parties.
212.author: FRANCE24

213.title: Fighting ongoing across DRC's Goma, Rwanda troops in city, says UN

FRANCE 24's Gavin Lee speaks to the Anglican Bishop of Goma, Martin Gordon, who fled the town on Saturday, about his experience and the latest developments on the ground.
213.author: FRANCE24

214.title: Lessons from the last survivors: How to remember the Holocaust?
214.summary: Some 50 former inmates of the largest of the Nazi death camps at Auschwitz-Birkinau making the trip to Poland for the 80th anniversary. How to process the collective folly of the industrial-scale mass extermination of one million Jews along with 100-thousand others in the space of a few short years?The Holocaust shattered the belief that technology could only be synonymous with progress and on that score, the gas chambers serve as a cautionary tale. How do citizens and nations remember in 2025? From the former Soviets whose forefathers liberated the camps to nations at the other end of the globe untouched by World War Two, what’s the lesson?The words "never again" ring hollow in today's world. An all-too-long list of genocides that have unfolded since. How then to talk about it?
214.author: François PICARD

215.title: 'There are a number of hostages that have lost their lives'
215.summary: "There are a number of hostages that have lost their lives", noted Mark Owen, FRANCE 24's correspondent in Jerusalem. Other hostages "are coming though alive and well", he added. The Israeli government revealed in a news conference various aspects of psychological torture that some of the hostages have undergone, which "clearly points to an issue of a war crime being committed".

216.title: M23 rebel group advances into eastern DR Congo, entering city of Goma
216.summary: Fighting has escalated sharply in eastern Congo, where Rwandan-backed M23 rebels have seized key towns and are closing in on the city of Goma, the government’s last stronghold in the region bordering Rwanda. Analysis by Thierry Vircoulon, associate researcher at IFRI Africa Centre.

217.title: Rwanda-backed M23 group enters DR Congo city of Goma

218.title: 80th anniversary of Auschwitz liberation: the victims of the Shoah remembered in ceremony
218.summary: For organizers, this is the last commemoration of the liberation of Auschwitz with so many survivors. At the largest of the Nazi death camps, some four dozen of those who lived to tell the tale on hand spoke. Among them, 86-year old Tova Friedman. The Polish-born American recalled those dark days of many years ago. Details by FRANCE 24 journalist Andrew Hilliar.
218.author: FRANCE24

219.title: How much recognition is there in Poland about what happened on Polish soil during WWII?

How much recognition is there in Poland about what happened on Polish soil during WWII? FRANCE 24's Nadia Massih asked Jan Grabowski, co-founder of the Polish Centre for Holocaust.
219.author: FRANCE24

220.title: Chinese startup DeepSeek threatens ChatGPT’s dominance of AI sector

The results sent a shock wave through the AI sector worldwide and cast doubt on whether US technology firms could sustain their leadership position.

221.title: Gunfire heard in DR Congo's Goma as M23 rebels, Rwandan troops close in

221.author: FRANCE 24

222.title: Aja Monet: From bard to bandleader
222.summary: In this edition of our Arts24 music show, Jennifer Ben Brahim chats with poet and activist Aja Monet. She started putting pen to paper at just eight years old, thanks to a fascination with storytelling and typewriters. Her poetry has garnered critical acclaim, such as the collection "My Mother was a Freedom Fighter". Her activism has taken her from New York to Palestine. Aja's debut album "When the Poems Do What They Do" is a fluid blend of poetry and jazz. It is also an ode to some of the greats from the Black Arts Movement like Nikki Giovanni and Amiri Baraka. Aja described how she felt like a "spiritual archivist" when putting together the album. She is on tour in Europe with the record and is set to drop a new collection of poetry entitled "Florida Waters" this June.
222.author: Jennifer BEN BRAHIM

223.title: Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians return to devastated northern Gaza

224.title: Eighty years on, French deportee remembers horror of Auschwitz and difficult return home
224.summary: On January 27, 1945, the French population had yet to grasp the full horror of the Holocaust. After the Soviet army finally liberated Auschwitz and the allies advanced on the Western front, the first survivors began to trickle back to their home countries and the true scale of the tragedy began to emerge. Esther Dzik was one of the survivors who returned to Paris in 1945. She'd been deported in September 1943 at the age of 15 and sent to Auschwitz, where her own sister perished. Now 97 years old, she tells us about the conditions in the camp, her resolve to survive and the struggle to rebuild her life after her whole family was murdered.
224.author: David GILBERG

225.title: 80 years after the liberation of Auschwitz death camp, the last survivors continue testifying
225.summary: Ahead of the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz death camp, FRANCE 24 reporter Claire Paccalin has spoken to several survivors in France. What have survivors told her about what was the journey like for those deported?

226.title: 80 years after Auschwitz liberation: 'the last round anniversary in which survivors will take part'

'This is the last round anniversary in which survivors will take part' says Jan Grabowski, co-founder of the Polish Centre for Holocaust.

227.title: When Paris's Hotel Lutetia hosted concentration camp survivors
227.summary: Eighty years ago, on January 27, 1945, the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration and extermination camp was liberated by Soviet troops. During the following weeks and months, French survivors of the camps made their way home. A third of them passed through the Hotel Lutetia in Paris, a luxury hotel that was requisitioned by the French state to host the former prisoners. Many families went to the Lutetia, desperately hoping to find out if their loved ones had returned. FRANCE 24's Stéphanie Trouillard and Claire Paccalin spoke to survivors of the camps who passed through the hotel, as well as the daughter of a man who perished in Auschwitz-Birkenau.
227.author: Stéphanie TROUILLARD

228.title: Fire ravages Paris district town hall, leaving spire 'in danger of collapsing'

Paris police prefect Laurent Nunez warned the 36-metre spire was ‘in danger of collapsing’ after firefighters extinguished the fire Monday morning.

229.title: Auschwitz liberation, 80 years on: French survivors remember horror
229.summary: This Monday marks 80 years since the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration and extermination camp was liberated by Soviet forces. In this edition of Entre Nous we speak to FRANCE 24 senior reporter Claire Paccalin, who has filmed a series of reports on French survivors of the camp and children of victims. She tells us their harrowing stories.
229.author: Genie GODULA

230.title: Nick Winton, son of 'Britain's Schindler': 'For him, it wasn't about recognition'
230.summary: The son of the man often described as "Britain's Schindler" has spoken of his pride at what his late father achieved. On the 80th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp, we spoke to the son of Sir Nicholas Winton, who with his small team is credited with saving the lives of 669 mostly Jewish children on the eve of World War II in what was then Czechoslovakia. The incredible story went largely unrecognised for years until a 1980s British television programme, "That's Life", managed to find an entire audience of people whose lives had been saved thanks to Winton, who was surprised to discover that every single other person there owed their lives to him. His incredible story was recently told in the film "One Life". His son Nick Winton spoke to us in Perspective.
230.author: Stuart NORVAL

376.author: Andrea Castillo

377.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
377.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
377.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

378.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
378.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
378.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

379.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
379.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
379.author: Robin Abcarian

380.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
380.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
380.author: Kevin Rector

381.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
381.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
381.author: Seema Mehta

382.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
382.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
382.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

383.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
383.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
383.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

384.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
384.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
384.author: Lila Seidman

385.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
385.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
385.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

386.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
386.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
386.author: Doyle McManus

387.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
387.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
387.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

388.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
388.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
388.author: Kevin Rector

389.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
389.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
389.author: Seema Mehta

390.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
390.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
390.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

391.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
391.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
391.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

392.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
392.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
392.author: A.T. McWilliams

393.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
393.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
393.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

394.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
394.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
394.author: Karen Kaplan

395.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
395.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
395.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

396.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
396.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
396.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

397.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
397.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
397.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

398.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
398.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
398.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

399.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
399.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
399.author: Doyle McManus

400.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
400.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
400.author: Mark Z. Barabak

401.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
401.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
401.author: Jackie Calmes

402.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
402.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
402.author: Max Kim

403.title: Trump expected to survey Los Angeles-area wildfire damage this week
403.summary: President-elect Donald Trump, in perhaps his first official trip after being inaugurated Monday, will likely visit the Los Angeles area to survey wildfire damage late next week.
403.author: Seema Mehta

404.title: Supreme Court will decide if parents may reject LGBTQ+ lessons for their kids
404.summary: Supreme Court will take up a dispute over grade school textbooks that include LGBTQ+ themes, pitting religious rights against individual rights.
404.author: David G. Savage

405.title: Brad Pitt's team reminds fans he's not on social media after a woman gets big-time scammed
405.summary: Brad Pitt is not on social media, his team reminded fans, after a French woman said she was conned out of $800,000 by scammers posing as the A-list actor.
405.author: Nardine Saad

406.title: Supreme Court upholds law that could force TikTok to shut down in U.S.
406.summary: Congress and now the Supreme Court say TikTok must separate itself from its Chinese owners or shut down operations in the U.S.
406.author: David G. Savage

407.title: Joan Plowright, award-winning 'Enchanted April' and 'Stalin' actor, dies at 95
407.summary: Joan Plowright, the celebrated English actor whose career included the films 'Enchanted April,' 'The Entertainer' and 'Spiderwick Chronicles,' has died at 95.
407.author: Alexandra Del Rosario

408.title: Opinion: What a century-old disaster can teach fire-ravaged L.A. about recovery and rebuilding
408.summary: Some in the fire-ravaged city have taken to laying personal blame. But what endures from the Canadian disaster is the generosity of those who helped rebuild.
408.author: Ben Proudfoot

409.title: Migration across the U.S.-Mexico border, in 5 charts
409.summary: Arrivals at the border are the lowest they've been since incoming President Trump first left office in 2021.
409.author: Andrea Castillo, Koko Nakajima

410.title: Trump made many 'Day 1' promises. Will he make good on them?
410.summary: President-elect Donald Trump could start taking action Monday on his many "Day 1" campaign promises, but California officials and others are ready to fight.
410.author: Kevin Rector

411.title: Bitter feud among Sinaloa cartel families brings grim new tactic: Grave desecration
411.summary: In the escalating war among rival factions of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, sons of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán are suspected of ordering the destruction of elaborate mausoleums that belong to rival families, including one for a fallen grandson of Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada.
411.author: Keegan Hamilton

412.title: Fire lessons from the Australian capital, where a 2003 inferno changed everything
412.summary: Two decades ago, fire ripped through Canberra, destroying 480 homes. An Australian fire chief reflects on possible lessons for California.
412.author: Max Kim

413.title: Padilla hopes to increase firefighter pay, create affordable housing for disaster response
413.summary: California Sen. Alex Padilla introduced several bills to increase firefighter pay, expand FEMA funding and include affordable housing as part of disaster response.
413.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

414.title: Harris joins a decades-old tradition for vice presidents in her final days in office
414.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, in one of her last public appearances in the role, signed her ceremonial desk drawer at the White House on Thursday, a tradition that dates back nearly a century.
414.author: Seema Mehta

415.title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi will not attend Trump's inauguration
415.summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) will not attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump.
415.author: Kevin Rector

416.title: Calmes: The case of the missing Hegseth investigation
416.summary: Trump's unfit nominee for Defense secretary gets the benefit of an incomplete, half-baked and secret FBI report.
416.author: Jackie Calmes

417.title: What will Mexico do if Trump tries to mass deport non-Mexicans across the border?
417.summary: How will Mexican leaders respond if, as expected, Trump pressures them to accept deportees from third countries? 'Mexico is in a really tough spot.'
417.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

418.title: Supreme Court leans in favor of state-enforced age limits on porn websites
418.summary: Can Texas and other red states limit children from instant access to vast amounts of online pornography? The Supreme Court will decide.
418.author: David G. Savage

419.title: Neil Gaiman denies sexual assault allegations: 'I don't accept there was any abuse'
419.summary: Neil Gaiman, the bestselling fantasy author, denies sexual abuse allegations made by eight women in an explosive New York Magazine article.
419.author: Nardine Saad

420.title: The FDA knew long ago that red dye No. 3 causes cancer. Why did it take so long to ban it?
420.summary: The FDA banned the use of red dye No. 3 in foods and medicines sold in the U.S. because it has been shown to cause cancer in rats. The action highlights the limits of a federal law known as the Delaney clause.
420.author: Karen Kaplan

421.title: Sen. Marco Rubio appears set to win confirmation as secretary of State
421.summary: Rubio and Trump have put aside past acrimony to make the Florida lawmaker the least controversial in an unusual slate of Cabinet picks.
421.author: Tracy Wilkinson

422.title: Cease-fire deal reached between Israel and Hamas in Gaza
422.summary: A cease-fire deal, announced by U.S. and Qatari mediators, promises to end more than a year of conflict in Gaza Strip. Some Israeli hostages would be exchanged for Palestinian prisoners under the agreement.
422.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King, Nabih Bulos

423.title: Trump's tariffs brought China and Mexico closer. Will his second term change that?
423.summary: China has strengthened trade with Latin America at the expense of the U.S. But Donald Trump, who threatens to raise tariffs on Mexico, could upend those ties.
423.author: Stephanie Yang

424.title: Biden administration to lift 'terrorism' designation on Cuba
424.summary: In its waning days, the first Trump administration put Cuba on terrorism list. Biden is removing it.
424.author: Tracy Wilkinson

425.title: 'TikTok refugees' unexpectedly turn to Chinese alternative as ban looms
425.summary: A number of TikTok users appear to be turning to an app called RedNote — more commonly known to its majority-Chinese audience by its Chinese name, Xiaohongshu.
425.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

426.title: The Senate is considering the Laken Riley Act. Here's what it would do
426.summary: The bill would require immigration officers to detain immigrants who are suspected of minor theft and cede some federal immigration enforcement power to states.
426.author: Andrea Castillo

427.title: Kate Middleton's cancer is now in remission: 'It takes time to adjust to a new normal'
427.summary: Catherine, Princess of Wales, confirmed Tuesday that her cancer is in remission during a visit with the staff and patients of the Royal Marsden in Chelsea.
427.author: Nardine Saad

428.title: Special counsel report says Trump would've been convicted for 'unprecedented criminal effort' in Jan. 6 case
428.summary: The report, arriving just days before Trump is to return to office, focuses fresh attention on his failed effort to cling to power after his election loss in 2020.
428.author: Alanna Durkin Richer, Eric Tucker and Colleen Long

429.title: Supreme Court denies oil industry plea to block climate lawsuits filed by California, other blue states
429.summary: Supreme Court will not block California's suit against big oil companies for damage from climate change.
429.author: David G. Savage

430.title: Column: Trump wants to grab control of Greenland, Canada and the Panama Canal. He's already bungled it
430.summary: Trump wants to take Greenland from Denmark, make Canada the 51st state and retake the Panama Canal, threats reflecting his view that might makes right.
430.author: Doyle McManus

431.title: Newsom suspends landmark environmental laws to ease rebuilding in wildfire zones
431.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom on Sunday signed an executive order suspending parts of the Coastal Act and the California Environmental Quality Act to aid homeowners rebuilding after losses in last week's wildfires.
431.author: Seema Mehta, Liam Dillon, Rosanna Xia

432.title: Calmes: Merrick Garland's integrity saved the DOJ only to doom it again
432.summary: Atty. Gen. Merrick Garland's uprightness rescued the Department of Justice from Donald Trump's grip. But then he handed it over again.
432.author: Jackie Calmes

433.title: 'This is your Hurricane Katrina': Assessing the long road ahead for L.A.
433.summary: Craig Fugate, who led the Federal Emergency Management Agency in the Obama administration, has seen a lot of natural disasters.
433.author: Kevin Rector

434.title: Opinion: Why Israel can't just 'cut the head off' of Hamas or Hezbollah
434.summary: These groups are organic and homegrown, unlike the Islamic State or Al Qaeda, which have relied heavily on fighters from abroad. Hamas and Hezbollah will replenish their ranks with locals.
434.author: Colin P. Clarke

435.title: Column: 'Are you OK?' Thank you for asking about us in fire-ravaged L.A.
435.summary: If you live in Southern California, you're getting the messages via text, email, IMs, chats and every other way imaginable: People worldwide asking if you are safe.
435.author: Lorraine Ali

436.title: 'They just got my uncle': Immigration arrests spark fear among farmworkers in Central Valley
436.summary: Dozens have been arrested in the heavily agricultural Kern County during a multiple-day operation by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
436.author: Rachel Uranga, Andrea Castillo

437.title: 2024 was the hottest year on record, NASA and NOAA confirm
437.summary: Weather organizations from around the world agree that the planet's average global surface temperature in 2024 could well have passed a crucial threshold meant to limit the worst effects of climate change.
437.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

438.title: Supreme Court casts doubt on TikTok's free-speech defense as shutdown law is set to take effect
438.summary: Supreme Court is not likely to save TikTok from a U.S. shutdown, but incoming President Trump may try.
438.author: David G. Savage, Andrea Chang

439.title: South Korea's far right borrows from Trump's playbook to bolster impeached Yoon
439.summary: The president's conservative supporters contend that the country has been overrun by North Korea sympathizers conspiring to destroy South Korea's freedoms.
439.author: Max Kim

440.title: Alec Baldwin sues New Mexico, claiming malicious prosecution
440.summary: Six months after being cleared of criminal charges in the "Rust" shooting death, actor Alec Baldwin has filed a suit alleging malicious prosecution and defamation by New Mexico prosecutors and law enforcement.
440.author: Meg James

441.title: Supreme Court turns down Trump plea to block New York sentencing for hush money conviction
441.summary: Trump and his lawyers saw Supreme Court as a friendly forum, but it turned down his request.
441.author: David G. Savage

442.title: News Analysis: Carter, during and after presidency, changed way world saw the U.S. — often for the better
442.summary: He brought human rights to forefront in foreign policy, laid security foundations that have endured.
442.author: Tracy Wilkinson

443.title: Calmes: Jimmy Carter, Joe Biden and revisionist presidential history
443.summary: Even Republicans, who have used President Carter to attack Democrats for nearly 50 years, have had to reckon with revisionism.
443.author: Jackie Calmes

444.title: Jimmy Carter and the sad saga of a 9-ton Northern California peanut
444.summary: Former President Jimmy Carter once was offered a gift from Northern California: a 9-ton peanut carved from a redwood tree. His aides said no thanks.
444.author: Hailey Branson-Potts

445.title: Biden celebrates birth of great-grandchild after briefing on L.A. wildfires
445.summary: President Biden announced that he became a great-grandfather on Wednesday after his granddaughter Naomi gave birth in Los Angeles.
445.author: Liam Dillon

446.title: A long, freezing wait for a few hushed moments: A people's farewell to Jimmy Carter
446.summary: What people thought about at the public viewing of Jimmy Carter lying in state in the Capitol: reflections on a long and well-lived life, anxiety over what lies ahead.
446.author: Laura King

447.title: China's DeepSeek fuels US stock market chaos: Tech stocks slump, NVIDIA plunges 17% - what we know so far
447.summary: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has emerged as a strong competitor, causing a major sell-off in US tech stocks. Nvidia witnessed a dramatic 17.95% drop. DeepSeek’s R1 model, which matches US-developed AI systems at a lower cost, has raised investor concerns about the future of AI investments. Accusations of secret access to NVIDIA’s chips add to the controversy.
447.author: TOI Business Desk

448.title: Trump's border czar Tom Homan reacts to Selena Gomez bawling over deportations: 'No apologies'
448.summary: Tom Homan asserts that the Trump administration will continue with mass deportations despite celebrity backlash, emphasizing that the operations are aimed at enhancing community safety. The recent ICE raids have led to significant arrests, sparking emotional responses from public figures like Selena Gomez. “We're going to do this operation without apology. We're gonna make our community safer. It is all for the good of this nation. And we're gonna keep going. No apologies. We're moving forward," Tom Homan said.
448.author: TOI World Desk

449.title: Is Elon Musk's access to Donald Trump being limited by 'ice maiden' Susie Wiles? Here's the truth
449.summary: When Donald Trump was asked whether Elon Musk was getting an office in the West Wing, he said, "No". "He's getting an office for about 20 people that we're hiring to make sure that these (savings) get implemented," Trump said referring to Elon Musk's work as Department of Government Efficiency chief.
449.author: TOI World Desk

450.title: 'Aren't you American?': Republicans slam Selena Gomez for sobbing over Trump's crackdown on illegal immigrants
450.summary: Selena Gomez faced criticism after she posted an emotional Instagram story where she was sobbing about immigrants who are being deported. “All my people are getting attacked, the children. I don’t understand. I’m so sorry, I wish I could do something but I can’t. I don’t know what to do. I’ll try everything, I promise," she said drawing immediate backlash forcing her to delete that post.
450.author: TOI World Desk

451.title: Elon Musk questions DeepSeek microchip claims, calls it 'DeeperSeek'
451.summary: Elon Musk reacted to a post that claimed that DeppSeek has about 50,000 Nvidia H100s that they can't talk about because of the US export controls that are in place. "Obviously," Elon Musk wrote. The post was based on the claim of Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang with whom Elon Musk agreed about what DeepSeek AI is not revealing.
451.author: TOI World Desk

452.title: Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli emphasises coalition cooperation amid opposition allegations
452.summary: Nepal PM KP Sharma Oli urged cooperation between ruling coalition partners, Nepali Congress and CPN-UML, to ensure political stability and development. Speaking at an event, he reaffirmed support for Nepali Congress President Sher Bahadur Deuba under their power-sharing deal. In a coalition meeting, Oli emphasized prioritizing service delivery, accelerating development projects, and expediting legislation ahead of the winter parliamentary session. Leaders also discussed strategies to handle opposition challenges.

453.title: Former Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg faces legal consequences after split with Mark Zuckerberg, accused of 'using gmail' and 'deleting emails'
453.summary: Sheryl Sandberg, former Meta COO, is facing legal issues connected to the Cambridge Analytica scandal, including allegations of using personal email accounts and deleting critical emails. Sanctioned by a Delaware court, Sandberg must now provide clear and convincing evidence to defend herself. This case highlights ongoing privacy concerns and internal conflicts within Meta.
453.author: TOI World Desk

454.title: Earthquake rattles houses in Maine and is felt hundreds of miles away
454.summary: A 3.8-magnitude earthquake struck near York Harbor, Maine, on Monday morning, shaking buildings across New England and surprising residents as far as Pennsylvania. Centered six miles southeast of York Harbor at a depth of eight miles, the quake caused no reported damage or injuries, according to local emergency management agencies. While rare in the region, minor earthquakes occur in New England annually. Residents reported feeling strong shaking, but operations and infrastructure remained unaffected.

455.title: Robert F Kennedy Jr's famous name and controversial views collide in his bid for top health job
455.summary: Robert F Kennedy Jr, known for his anti-vaccine stance and controversial health ideas, is seeking confirmation as the US secretary of health and human services under President Donald Trump. Facing opposition from both Democrats and conservatives, Kennedy has softened his views, pledging to align with Trump’s directives on abortion and food policies. His past advocacy against vaccines, including a controversial visit to Samoa, has drawn scrutiny. Farmers and senators are divided over his proposals to ban corn syrup and pesticides, citing economic and health concerns. Kennedy's confirmation hearings begin this week.

456.title: Kamala Harris' husband returns to corporate law, joins Willkie Farr & Gallagher in Manhattan
456.summary: Doug Emhoff, husband of former vice president Kamala Harris, joined the law firm Willkie Farr & Gallagher as a partner starting Monday, a week after Donald Trump's inauguration and their official exit from the White House. Kamala Harris has not dropped any hint about what is going to be her next assignment after two decades of public service. She can prepare for the 2026 California governor election or the 2028 presidential election.
456.author: TOI World Desk

457.title: EU appoints new envoy for Kosovo, Serbia talks
457.summary: The European Union has appointed Danish diplomat Peter Sorensen as its new special envoy for the stalled Serbia-Kosovo dialogue, starting in February. Sorensen succeeds Miroslav Lajcak and aims to revive talks that collapsed in March 2023 over a failed normalization agreement. With decades of experience in the Western Balkans, Sorensen will work to ease tensions rooted in Kosovo's 2008 independence, which Serbia still refuses to recognize.

458.title: Sweden's national security advisor resigns over mislaid documents
458.summary: Sweden’s national security advisor, Henrik Landerholm, resigned after police launched an investigation into his mishandling of classified documents left at a hotel in 2023. Other incidents, including forgetting his phone at Hungary's embassy and misusing taxpayer funds for personal trips, added to the controversy. Landerholm, a longtime friend of prime minister Ulf Kristersson, faced mounting pressure to step down, with Kristersson acknowledging his role was untenable amid the investigation.

459.title: Viral post claims Sasha Obama spotted looking depressed amid divorce rumors of Barack, Michelle
459.summary: Barack and Michelle Obama's daughter, Sasha, was seen for the first time since rumors of her parents' divorce emerged, according to reports. Sasha appeared somber in the viral photo triggering speculations about whether the rumors of her parents' divorcing and her father Barack Obama dating Jennifer Aniston affected her. In the photo, Sasha who is a student is seen carrying books.
459.author: TOI World Desk

460.title: Young Africans add to pressure on museums over looted art, says UN
460.summary: A new generation of Africans is increasing pressure on Western museums to return looted artefacts, reflecting growing awareness and changing attitudes, says Unesco's Ernesto Ottone. While countries like France and Britain hold vast collections of stolen cultural heritage, restitution efforts remain complex, often requiring bespoke laws. Some items, like Benin bronzes and Madagascar's royal crown, have been loaned, but widespread returns face legal and political resistance, stalling progress.

461.title: Pete Hegseth confirms DEI will be removed from military as he arrives for first day on his new job
461.summary: As Pete Hegseth reached the Pentagon Monday morning starting his new job as the defense secretary of the Trump administration, he said, "Every moment that I'm here, I'm thinking about the guys and gals in Guam, in Germany, in Fort Benning, and Fort Bragg, on missile defense sites, and aircraft carriers. Our job is lethality and readiness and warfighting."
461.author: TOI World Desk

462.title: How DeepSeekR1 falls silent when asked about China, Xi Jinping, or Chairman Mao
462.summary: There’s an epic scene in Gangajaal, the cult classic movie made by Bollywood director Prakash Jha where Ajay Devgn’s character SP Amit Kumar chews out Inspector Bachcha Yadav who appears to be an extremely diligent officer who follows the forces of law and order until it comes to cases of the Yadav family where he moves with the alacrity of a snail returning home from a funeral after on a lazy Sunday afternoon. DeepSeekR1, the LLM that everyone seems to be talking about has a similar flaw especially when asked any prickly questions about China, Mao, Xi Jinping or his resemblance to Winnie the Pooh.
462.author: TOI World Desk

463.title: Firms should add local components to sell in EU: union
463.summary: Germany's largest union, IG Metall, proposed that foreign companies selling products in the EU should use European-made components. Juergen Kerner, the union's deputy head, emphasized that carmakers from China and the US should assemble products with European parts if they want to sell in the region. While advocating for a balanced approach to avoid trade tensions, IG Metall stressed the importance of transforming Germany's economy, especially ahead of the upcoming election, urging voters to focus on economic issues.

464.title: Who is Mohammed Sinwar? 'The shadow' and brother of slain chief Yahya Sinwar, spearheading Hamas' revival
464.summary: Mohammed Sinwar, the younger brother of slain Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, has risen to a crucial leadership role within Hamas. Amidst Israel's ongoing military attacks, Mohammed has been instrumental in rebuilding the group and retaining its influence over Gaza. His leadership is significantly bolstered by his connection to his late brother.
464.author: TOI World Desk

465.title: White House claims victory in a showdown with Colombia over taking deported migrants
465.summary: The White House claimed victory in its dispute with Colombia over the deportation of migrants, after President Trump threatened steep tariffs and sanctions. Tensions arose when Colombia's President Gustavo Petro rejected US military flights carrying deported migrants, citing mistreatment concerns. In response, Trump imposed a 25 per cent tariff on Colombian imports, with a potential increase to 50 per cent. The situation highlighted the Trump administration's stance on immigration and its use of economic pressure.

466.title: After FAFO, it's BAMF over Trump-Colombia faceoff. Elon Musk's mother asks what it means
466.summary: After Donald Trump dropped FAFO over the US-Colombia tariff war triggered by the migrants' issue, Elon Musk Sunday introduced BAMF to X reacting to how the Colombia government caved in and agreed to all terms of Donald Trump. Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk who is also very active on X, the platform that her son owns, wondered what BAMF meant and she said she found out the answer from Grok, X's artificial intelligence.
466.author: TOI World Desk

467.title: Art heist burglars use explosives to rob museum
467.summary:
Thieves have stolen a golden helmet considered a national treasure of Romania from a museum in the Netherlands
Read Full Article at RT.com
467.author: RT

468.title: Do not use terms like ‘black sheep’ and ‘blacklist’ – guide for UK police
468.summary:
British police officers have been encouraged to avoid using certain common phrases due to concerns about potential racial insensitivity
Read Full Article at RT.com
468.author: RT

469.title: Farting whale behind ‘Russian’ submarine false alarm – media
469.summary:
Britain’s Royal Navy launched a hunt for a stealthy submarine over what turned out to be whale flatulence
Read Full Article at RT.com
469.author: RT

470.title: Affront to history: The nation that liberated Auschwitz is being excluded from memory
470.summary:
A growing trend of revising WWII history risks erasing the immense sacrifices made by the Soviet Union in the fight against Nazi Germany
Read Full Article at RT.com
470.author: RT

471.title: Poland to question ex-justice minister over spyware
471.summary:
Former Polish Justice Minister Zbigniew Ziobro will answer questions about the alleged use of Israeli spyware against political rivals
Read Full Article at RT.com
471.author: RT

472.title: Serbian deputy PM slams Russia’s exclusion from Holocaust commemoration
472.summary:
Serbian Deputy PM Aleksandar Vulin criticized the absence of Russian representatives at the Auschwitz liberation commemoration
Read Full Article at RT.com
472.author: RT

687.title: A Lasting Peace Between Israelis and Palestinians
687.summary:
PORTLAND, USA / JERUSALEM, Jan 27 (IPS) - Following the long-sought cease-fire agreement between Israel and Hamas, the major challenge for the Israelis and the stateless Palestinians is how to achieve a lasting peace that will end the disastrous cycle of death, destruction, displacement and despair.

Read the full story, “A Lasting Peace Between Israelis and Palestinians”, on globalissues.org →

688.title: Kenya’s Shadow War on Activism
688.summary:
LONDON, Jan 27 (IPS) - Kenya’s young protesters are paying a high price for speaking out. Last June, a protest movement led by first-time activists from Generation Z emerged in response to the government’s Finance Bill, which would have introduced sweeping tax increases. The government quickly withdrew its plans, but protests continued, articulating anger at economic strife, elite corruption and out-of-touch politicians. The government’s response has been violent. Police have used batons, teargas and water cannon against protesters. On the worst day of violence, 25 June, when some protesters attempted to storm parliament, police fired live ammunition. Over 60 people were reported killed during the protests. At least 1,200 were reportedly arrested.

Read the full story, “Kenya’s Shadow War on Activism”, on globalissues.org →

689.title: Rising Opposition Movement Looks to Political Renewal, Stemming Erosion of Democracy in Hungary
689.summary:
BUDAPEST, Jan 27 (IPS) - The Central European nation of Hungary is officially a democracy. But civil society, the media and democratic norms have increasingly come under threat as the Fidesz-KDNP coalition government, led by Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, has entrenched autocratic rule over the past 14 years. Now a new wave of energy and popularity is driving the younger opposition movement into the spotlight ahead of next year’s parliamentary election.

Read the full story, “Rising Opposition Movement Looks to Political Renewal, Stemming Erosion of Democracy in Hungary”, on globalissues.org →
